common_issues.title: Pieces Core Services Fails to Open Due to WebSocket Error
common_issues.description: Multiple users across macOS and Windows encountered WebSocketException with HTTP 404 error when opening Pieces Core Services.  The connection to 'http://127.0.0.1:39300/user/last_checked_in/stream#' failed to upgrade to websocket.  Potential solutions include checking Pieces Core Services installation, network connectivity, and firewall settings.

related_issues.title: Unable to open Pieces Core Services
related_issues.text:
Unable to open Pieces Core Services
Error: WebSocketException: Connection to 'http://127.0.0.1:39300/user/last_checked_in/stream#' was not upgraded to websocket, HTTP status code: 404

**Installation Details**

Succeeded: true
Path: /Applications/Pieces OS.app

**PiecesOS Information**

ID: FB0FAE84-6BAC-4EC2-BBC8-8A15651E0677
User: 01ce0083-f75f-41c5-a161-943ada0edc94

Max Version Supported: 13.0.0
Local Port: 39300

**Device Information**

Current Version: Version 15.5 (Build 24F74)
Min Version Supported: 12.0.0 Monterey

common_issues.title: Pieces Core Services Fails to Open Due to WebSocket Error
common_issues.description: Multiple users across macOS and Windows are unable to open Pieces Core Services.  The error is a WebSocketException with a 404 HTTP status code, indicating the service isn't running or accessible at the expected endpoint (http://127.0.0.1:39300). Check if Pieces Core Services is running, verify network connectivity, and ensure the correct port is being used. Reinstallation or checking firewall settings may also be necessary.

recommendations: Prioritize resolving the "Unable to open Pieces Core Services" issue, which has the highest activity level and frequency across macOS and Windows. Investigate the root cause of the WebSocketException and HTTP 404 error.
Address the performance issues with the Pieces desktop application, specifically the slowness and lack of response in Copilot chat (Ticket #315).
Investigate and resolve the "Ollama Fails to Install on Linux" issue (Ticket #537) and "Long-Term Memory Feature Not Working on Linux" issue (Ticket #568) to improve the Linux user experience.
Ensure the Raycast extension is compatible with the current version of Raycast (Ticket #781).
Investigate the crash reported when scrolling or moving a window to another screen (Ticket #771).
